DataElement.preferredName: Prior Therapy Carboplatin Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether the patient has met the eligibility criteria regarding having received prior carboplatin therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the prior administration of carboplatin, a second-generation platinum compound with a broad spectrum of antineoplastic properties.  Carboplatin contains a platinum atom complexed with two ammonia groups and a cyclobutane-dicarboxyl residue.  This agent is activated intracellularly to form reactive platinum complexes that bind to nucleophilic groups such as GC-rich sites in DNA, thereby inducing intrastrand and interstrand DNA cross-links, as well as DNA-protein cross-links.  These carboplatin-induced DNA and protein effects result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.  This agent possesses tumoricidal activity similar to that of its parent compound, cisplatin, but is more stable and less toxic.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A second-generation platinum compound with a broad spectrum of antineoplastic properties.  Carboplatin contains a platinum atom complexed with two ammonia groups and a cyclobutane-dicarboxyl residue.  This agent is activated intracellularly to form reactive platinum complexes that bind to nucleophilic groups such as GC-rich sites in DNA, thereby inducing intrastrand and interstrand DNA cross-links, as well as DNA-protein cross-links.  These carboplatin-induced DNA and protein effects result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.  This agent possesses tumoricidal activity similar to that of its parent compound, cisplatin, but is more stable and less toxic. (NCI04):The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior ca
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior carboplatin, unless given in neoadjuvant/adjuvant setting for curative intent, and no more than 6 months have elapsed since last carboplatin dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has relapsed ovarian cancer, have less than 6 months elapsed since last carboplatin dose?
